summary: Build a music-platform dashboard workflow where users can create/manage multiple artist profiles, and those profiles are visible to admins; additionally support admin logo management and improved song submission artist selection using artist-profile IDs.
architectural_notes: Store artist profiles as records with unique artist IDs; song submissions reference artist IDs (not free-text) to ensure data integrity.
Maintain backward compatibility by supporting legacy submissions with typed artist names and providing a mapping/migration strategy as needed.

existing_features.title: Update the user dashboard UI to let users create and manage multiple artist profiles (list existing profiles; allow create, edit, and delete).

Update the admin artist panel UI to display all user-created artist profiles (including multiple profiles per user) and allow searching and editing them, so profiles created in the user dashboard appear automatically in the admin panel.

Extend React Query hooks (`frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts`) to support the new multi-artist-profile APIs and update existing queries/mutations that currently assume a single artist profile so the app continues to function with multiple profiles.

new_feature_requests.summary: Allow users to create and manage multiple artist profiles from their user dashboard.
Show user-created artist profiles in the admin artist panel (admin can view/manage them).

Update song submission forms (user and admin) to select Artist/Featured Artist from created artist profiles (support multi-select), using unique artist IDs and backward compatibility for typed legacy entries.
Add admin dashboard controls to change or remove the website logo; store logo in backend; allow uploading any image file.

Update the backend data model to support multiple artist profiles per user (each profile must have a stable unique ID and an owner Principal), replacing the current single `artistProfiles : Map<Principal, ArtistProfile>` storage.
Add backend APIs to create, list, update, and delete artist profiles for the currently authenticated user, operating on artist profile IDs (not by overwriting a single profile).
Update admin-facing backend APIs so admins/team can retrieve and manage all user-created artist profiles in a way that allows the admin UI to show every artist profile (not just one per user).

Implement a conditional Motoko state migration so existing deployments with `artistProfiles : Map<Principal, ArtistProfile>` are upgraded to the new multi-profile storage while keeping the existing profile as a single entry for its owner.

projectName: Support multiple artist profiles per user and surface them in the admin artist panel
